entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud: Secure by Design and Intelligent by Default
entry.content:
(Jana Subramanian serves as APJ Principal Cybersecurity Advisor and Compliance and has been recognized as a Fellow of Information Privacy (FIP) by the International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP). As part of his responsibilities, Jana helps with strategic customer engagements related to topics such as cybersecurity, data privacy, secure data flow, multi-cloud security integration architecture, contractual assurance, audit, and compliance.)

Introduction

In today’s fast-moving business world, data is everywhere—but often stuck in silos, difficult to manage, and even harder to turn into action. SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) helps solve that. It is a fully managed (SaaS) cloud solution that brings together data from both SAP and non-SAP sources, making it easier to unify, govern, and use data across your business. For organizations already using SAP Business Warehouse (SAP BW), BDC offers a clear path to modernize in the cloud. At the core of BDC are Data Products—reusable, trusted datasets enriched with business context—and Intelligent Applications—AI-driven apps that consume these products to automate decisions and actions. By combining tools like SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud into a unified architecture, BDC removes the need for complex data extractions and ensures your data is always analytics ready.

In this blog, we will explore how BDC works, its key building blocks, and the strong security framework that keeps your enterprise data safe and actionable to enable secure by design and intelligent by default.

Core Components of SAP Business Data Cloud

SAP BDC is built upon a robust stack of integrated components, each playing a vital role in its functionality:

  • SAP Datasphere: The bedrock of SAP BDC, Datasphere provides a unified environment for comprehensive data integration, modeling, transformation, and governance. It supports diverse storage options—including high-performance in-memory, cost-effective disk, and object storage—via SAP HANA Cloud and Data Lake. It includes the Unified Semantic Layer, which standardizes business definitions and supports zero-copy data access across SAP and non-SAP tools. This flexibility makes it ideal for managing varied data needs and enables the creation and governance of reusable, business-ready data products.
  • SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC): Seamlessly integrated with Datasphere, SAC delivers advanced analytics, planning, and predictive capabilities. It provides real-time dashboards, embedded AI/ML insights, and dynamic visualizations that drive both operational efficiency and intelligent decision-making.
  • SAP Databricks: An SAP-managed Databricks runtime natively embedded within BDC, it brings powerful AI/ML, data science, and big data engineering capabilities directly into the SAP ecosystem. Utilizing zero-copy Delta Sharing, it directly accesses governed data products from SAP Datasphere, enabling advanced analytics on both SAP and non-SAP data without the need for replication.
  • The BDC Cockpit: Serving as the central administrative console for SAP Business Data Cloud, the BDC Cockpit allows users to manage roles, configurations, and deployments. For data analysts and data scientists, it also acts as the primary entry point to discover, activate, and monitor data products and intelligent applications.

 Figure 1: SAP Business Data Cloud - Core Components

 

Category

Component/Description

Key Functionality/Characteristics

SOURCE SYSTEMS

SAP S/4HANA (Cloud)

Origin of transactional and operational data

 

SAP SuccessFactors

Origin of HR data

 

SAP Cloud ERP

Origin of enterprise resource planning data

 

SAP BW/4HANA

Origin of historical and analytical data

 

Third-party systems

Origin of external data from non-SAP sources

SAP DATASPHERE

Connectors to source systems (e.g., SDA, DP Agent, JDBC, SDI)

Facilitates data ingestion from diverse sources

(DATA FABRIC LAYER)

Semantic modeling, data lineage, transformation

Defines data meaning, tracks data flow, prepares data for consumption

 

SAP Foundation Services: harmonization + metadata

Ensures data consistency and provides descriptive information about data

 

SAP Databricks runtime for zero-copy access & ML ops

Enables advanced data processing, machine learning operations directly on data without copying

 

Storage in SAP HANA Cloud or Data Lake

Stores integrated and processed data

DATA PRODUCTS LAYER

Curated & governed datasets

Provides ready-to-use, validated, and controlled data assets

 

Based on harmonized views and tables from Datasphere

Data products derived from the structured and harmonized data in Datasphere

 

Include metadata, access policies, lineage

Ensures data discoverability, security, and traceability

INTELLIGENT APPLICATIONS

SAP/Partner-built AI-driven business apps

Applications leveraging AI for specific business functions, built by SAP or partners

 

Use Data Products as input (not raw data)

Consume refined and governed data, not direct source data

 

Automate insights, simulate, forecast

Core capabilities of intelligent applications for business decision support

 

Embedded ML (Joule copilot, time-series models, simulations)

Machine learning capabilities integrated directly within applications, enhancing functionality

BROADER ECOSYSTEM

SAP Analytics (Cloud)

Tools for data visualization, reporting, and business intelligence

 

Joule

AI assistant/copilot for intelligent interactions (likely related to embedded ML)

 

SAP Databricks (used within Datasphere)

Platform for ML workflows & services, analytical queries, direct access to data products

 

GenAI Hub

Centralized hub for Generative AI capabilities and models

With a clear understanding of the components, let’s explore how key architectural principles—like data gravity and zero-copy sharing—bring these components to life. The principle of data gravity dictates processing data where it resides, minimizing unnecessary movement and duplication. This approach dramatically enhances performance, ensures data consistency, and simplifies governance. Building on this, zero-copy sharing allows datasets to be securely shared across different internal services and external platforms, such as SAP Databricks, without physical replication. This innovative capability ensures data freshness, eliminates redundancy, and drastically reduces the operational overhead associated with traditional data duplication.

Principle

Meaning

How SAP BDC Implements It

Data Gravity

Data attracts compute and services to where it resides, minimizing unnecessary movement.

Replicates source data into Datasphere once; downstream consumers access it in place.

Zero-Copy Data Sharing

Share data across services and tools without physically copying it.

Uses Delta Sharing to provide real-time access to data without duplication.

Governance by Design

Embed data quality, access control, and monitoring into the data lifecycle.

Implements RBAC, metadata, certification, and lineage across data products.

Semantic Consistency

Ensure consistent business definitions and semantics across all systems.

Applies Unified Semantic Layer for standard definitions across SAP and non-SAP data.

Open Data Consumption

Expose data through standardized APIs and protocols to support diverse tools.

Supports APIs, JDBC/ODBC, Delta Sharing, and open metadata standards (ORD, CSN).

AI-First Enablement

Design the architecture to natively support AI and machine learning workloads.

Provides curated data products for AI; integrates with SAP Joule and Databricks ML.

Federated but Governed Access

Enable distributed access while maintaining centralized visibility and control.

Formation-based access, central cockpit governance, and role-specific permissions.

Data-as-a-Product

Treat data as reusable, governed assets with clear ownership and lifecycle.

Data Products are cataloged, versioned, governed, and optionally monetized.

Multi-Layer Security in SAP BDC:

Customer Data Isolation:

The diagram above outlines the multi-layered isolation and security model underpinning SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). Each layer—from tenant and application isolation to data access and encryption—is designed to ensure secure separation of customer environments and data. BDC leverages SAP BTP subaccounts, SAP Analytics Cloud spaces, and HANA Cloud schema-level isolation to enforce strong boundaries across structured and unstructured data. Federated identity via SAP IAS and XSUAA, combined with fine-grained RBAC and AppRouter security, ensures only authorized users and apps can access data. Critically, all operational access is just-in-time, logged, and monitored, providing a strong audit trail and compliance posture. This layered defense approach enables secure, scalable, and compliant operations across diverse enterprise landscapes.

 Figure 2: Secure Multi-Layer Isolation

Security in SAP Business Data Cloud is enforced across every architectural layer, from ingestion to consumption. The table below highlights specific security considerations for each core component—covering access controls, identity management, encryption, data governance, and metadata protection. It reflects how BDC applies fine-grained controls using SAP IAS, RBAC, and semantic governance, while supporting zero-copy access and tenant isolation to ensure secure, scalable operations.

Component

Security Considerations

SAP and Non-SAP Source Systems

Source system authentication and authorization managed externally. Integration to BDC via secure connectors like ODP, JDBC, SDI DP Agent, with TLS encryption.

SAP BTP Customer Sub-Account

Tenant-level isolation. Access managed through SAP Identity Authentication Service (IAS), role-based access control (RBAC), and audit logging.

SAP Datasphere Instance

Provider-managed, provisioned within customer sub-account. Encrypted data at rest and in transit. Includes data lineage, access control, metadata protection.

SAP Data Products

Granular access control (RBAC), visibility settings (public, private, internal). Metadata includes data lineage, classification, ownership for governance.

SAP Datasphere Semantic Layer

Access control per semantic model. Inherits governance from data products. Metadata visibility is controlled.

SAP Databricks

Zero-copy access with authentication via shared identity provider. Data access governed via semantic layer permissions. Execution isolated in managed environments.

Intelligent Applications

Formation-based access controls. Deployed in provider-managed secure spaces (read-only). Can be copied into customer-managed spaces with RBAC.

SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC)

User authentication via IAS or SAP Universal ID. Live data connections use secure tunnels. Dashboard access controlled via SAC roles and teams.

Business Users/App UI

User-level permissions defined via roles. Interaction restricted by app layer controls, enforced least privilege access.

Data Scientist

Access to data products governed through RBAC. Execution environments are containerized and isolated. Notebook access secured via SAP-managed identity.

Data Products and Intelligent Applications

Data Product

  1. Standardized, curated, and governed datasets enriched with business context, semantics, and metadata.
  2. Designed for high-volume reuse across analytics, AI, and ML scenarios—reducing the need for custom pipelines or redundant extraction.
  3. Can be developed by SAP, customers, or partners.
  4. Stored flexibly across SAP Datasphere and SAP HANA Cloud Data Lake, supporting zero-copy access for downstream tools like SAP Databricks.
  5. Easily discoverable and installable through the BDC Cockpit and Data Marketplace, which provide rich metadata and role-based access control.
  6. Typically installed into customer-managed SAP Datasphere spaces, allowing customization while preserving governance.

Intelligent Application

  1. Prebuilt, AI-infused apps developed by SAP and partners to automate and optimize business workflows.
  2. Use Data Products as inputs for planning, simulation, forecasting, and decision support.
  3. Deploy with supporting assets like SAP Analytics Cloud dashboards, semantic models, and predefined logic.
  4. Designed for business users to interact with real-time insights securely and intuitively—no data wrangling required.

 Figure 3: Data Products and Intelligent Application

 

Security Domain

Data Products Layer

Intelligent Applications

Access Control

RBAC, Authentication via IAS, Delta Sharing policies

Formation-based access, user assignment controls app/data scope

Metadata & Lineage

ORD & CSN Standards, Data Product Certification

Transparent logic, knowledge graphs, semantic awareness, based on trusted data

Encryption

At Rest: SAP KMS; In Transit: TLS 1.2+

Same encryption as Data Products

Identity & Access

2FA via IAS/Universal ID

Inherits identity context, JSON Token, Scope, Role Collection; 2FA enforced via login

Responsibility Model

SAP: Infra & Platform Security

Customer: Roles, Identity Policies, Visibility

Conclusion

SAP Business Data Cloud is a secure and AI-ready platform that helps businesses manage and use complex data from across their systems. Built on technologies like SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP Databricks, it ensures data is high-quality, governed, and well-protected. At its core are Data Products—reusable, trusted datasets that follow a “data-as-a-product” model. These products are secured, certified by SAP, and governed through centralized policies.

Layered on top are Intelligent Applications, which use these data products to automate decisions across business processes. With support for both SAP and non-SAP data, and powered by advanced AI tools, these apps deliver fast, accurate insights to drive better outcomes.

entry.title: What's New in SAP BTP – Q2 2025
entry.content:
Q2 was another big quarter for SAP Business Technology Platform. From application development to integration and analytics, we are excited to share how SAP BTP continues to simplify, streamline, and speed things up! Let's dive into some of the top innovations!

App Dev & Automation Highlights 

Simplified SAPUI5 extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard 

If your business relies on cloud ERP as its IT backbone, you know it may need extensions to meet unique requirements. When built-in extensibility isn’t enough, SAP Build on SAP BTP offers powerful options for custom coding and SAP Fiori UI extensions.  

Now, with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard, you can create UI extensions directly from your cloud ERP application. By launching the Extensibility Wizard directly from your SAP Fiori application, you are given different options for the type of extension you want to create.

The 'User Interface Extension' lets you either adapt the existing Fiori app or create a new custom application. By setting up your destinations and details in the Wizard, you can either remove sections, add new fields, and create a completely new variant of the application with SAP Build Code and Business Application Studio. Developers and key users can already use it to create custom processes and now, custom user interfaces. 

Watch the video demo (starting at 0:08)  for more insights!   

Learn more:  Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Application to Enable Business Users to Manage Decisions

To empower business users to view or maintain decisions within SAP Build Process Automation, we launched a dedicated, purpose-built application that can be accessed directly from SAP Build Work Zone – without the need of IT. 

Business users can access a dedicated application in SAP Build Work Zone to manage decisions within a single project. Users can open the decision table, modify values directly, or import data from Excel and then save their changes, seeing only what matters and making the experience clean and focused. The release of a changed version is only one click away. Any errors are shown in the design console, letting users view the different versions of the project. 

See for yourself in the demo (starting at 2:05)  for more insights!

Learn more 

  • Configure the Stuido Home Application 
  • Using the Studio Home Application

Partner Solutions as an Installable Product on SAP BTP ABAP Environment 

Good news for SAP partners developing apps with SAP BTP ABAP Environment: you can now offer your solution not only as a multitenant Software as a Service solution, but also as an installable product! 

Customers can now install the solution directly in their system as a product. As a part of SAP BTP ABAP Environment, the Landscape Portal supports both delivery options: multitenant SaaS and installable product. 

You can do this in three easy steps:

  1. Build your product with the Register Product app. 
  2. Choose your delivery model: 
    • For multitenant SaaS, configure it in the Maintain Solution app  
    • For installable product, use the Publish Product app. 
  3. Publish your solution to the SAP Store with a PartnerEdge Build contract and an SAP Store enhancement. 

Now customers using SAP BTP ABAP Environment can find your product in the SAP Store and install it into their own system using the Deploy Product option. 

For detailed guidance, watch the demo (starting at 3:42). 

Learn more: Building partner products on SAP BTP ABAP Environment

Integration Highlight

Describe Externalized Parameters of an Integration Flow 

In SAP Integration Suite externalization enables integration developers to define parameters as variables for certain configurations of adapters or flow steps of an integration flow. The values of these parameters can be changed without editing the integration flow, for example, when moving integrations from development or test environment to production. To simplify the understanding of this difficult and technical process, content developers can now provide descriptions directly in the integration flow editor. These can be the potential values, examples or additional details explaining the impact of specific values which will then be visible for guiding through each of the fields in the Configure view. This brings huge potential to improve the maintainability and reusability of your integration scenarios.  

Take a look at the demo (starting at 5:21) and see for yourself! 

Learn more: Externalized Parameters View

Data & Analytics Highlight

Analytical insights in Joule 

Joule, SAP's copilot, now enables you to get quick analytical answers without having to build reports. This provides you with valuable insights, saving time and giving you the information you need. 

Joule scans available data sources and suggests a few options, making comparisons to previous months easier. Joule updates the view right away, making it easy to see how things are trending. For example, you can ask for the top ten sales agents, check the monthly commission trend from January to March, giving you contextual and relevant answers 

See this in action in the demo (starting 7:15).

Learn more: Introducing Analytical Insights in Joule: Empowering Smarter Decisions, Instantly

Cross Platform Highlight

Provision App-Specific Groups in Identity Directory 

SAP Cloud Identity Services tenant enables immediate provisioning of authorizations to target systems in SAP Analytics Cloud target system. You can  centrally manage user-group assignments linked to application-specific policies, triggering provisioning jobs that synchronize access rights efficiently and securely. This ensures users gain prompt access to their designated roles in the target system.

Watch the demo (starting at 8:37) for a closer look. 

Learn more: SAP Cloud Identity Services

Share your thoughts 

These videos are for YOU. We would love to hear your impressions. How do you like the video? How can we improve the upcoming videos? Please share your feedback by liking this post or leaving a comment below.

Thank you for your support and happy viewing, sharing, and enjoying!

You Might Also Be Interested In

  • SAP BTP Garage: monthly LIVE webinar with hands-on use case walkthroughs and demos.
  • SAP BTP Talk Podcast: monthly podcast covering all things SAP BTP.

entry.title: SAP BDC Ecosystem
entry.content:
By now you may have got a good understanding of SAP BDC components from my earlier blogs.

Now let's try to see how it all fits together.

 

 

At the first level we start with the data repository source. It may be an SAP system (like SAP S/4, Success Factor, SAP BW etc. )  or any non-SAP system.

Customers struggle a lot in heterogeneous system where data is stored in multiple different data storage systems. This data is vital for reporting.

 

For the data-driven modern organisations, having convenient access to all the necessary data in a specific and centralised location is important. Easy, convenient access ensures that data resources are always available at a moment’s notice, easing the process for you and allowing you to conduct all operations. 

 

With SAP BDC, various in-built SAP provided connectors available which we can use to connect to SAP as well as non-SAP systems and integrate them as a source of information i.e. transactional & master data.

SAP BDC system resides in SAP BTP platform similar to SAP Datasphere tenant sub-accounts currently. 

You will have a separate SAP Datasphere instance inside your SAP BDC environment.

SAP Datasphere is the evolution of the SAP data warehouse(earlier SAP BW) solution in the cloud, combining capabilities from SAP Data Warehouse Cloud with its agile enterprise data warehouse, self-service data modelling and SAP Data Intelligence Cloud with its data orchestration, lineage, quality, among other capabilities.

In data integration projects, a lot of time is spent trying to recreate context that has been lost during data replication, especially when getting data from the database layer belonging to heterogeneous storage systems.

With SAP BDC, customers will be able to bring all the structured and non-structured data under single umbrella in business data fabric.

This simplifies complex data landscapes and delivers meaningful data to every data consumer, be it Data architect, business user or a decision maker – it takes the benefits and value further by keeping the business logic and application context from data intact.

For each of the source systems, SAP has provided ready-to-use data products which can be found in SAP BDC Cockpit.

To use out-of-the-box Data Products in SAP Business Data Cloud with third-party data, first browse the available Data Products in the SAP Business Data Cloud Cockpit. Then select and install the one that best meets your requirements before proceeding with integration.

 

 

 

 SAP BDC system eliminates the need to recreate all the business context lost from extracting data - giving business stakeholders and data consumers the ability to accelerate their decision-making with trust and confidence, knowing they always have the complete picture of their data regardless of where it is stored or how it was designed.

 

SAP Data products are combination of curated views & tables, metadata, access control, inbound and outbound interfaces, load capabilities, data lineage etc. which are used by semantic layer in SAP Datasphere by consumption ready data models which can be then used for internal data manipulation and transformation.

 

This data can then be used for

  1. Reporting by SAP Analytics cloud through live data, dashboards and stories
  2. AI/ML capabilities by Databricks for powerful compute and advance analytics
  3. Visualization by intelligent apps for business users to interact with real-time insights securely and intuitively

 

SAP BDC replicates source data into Datasphere object store once; downstream consumers access it from there.

With use of delta Sharing , Databricks gets real-time access to data without duplication saving storage space and associated costs.

 

 

 

All in all, SAP BDC is built upon a robust stack of integrated components, each playing a vital role in its functionality.

  • SAP BDC combines SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and their capabilities into one fully managed SaaS solution for all data and analytics needs.
  • It seamlessly integrates mission-critical SAP data with third-party sources—without losing business context or requiring constant extraction.
  • SAP transforms and harmonizes business data within a hyperscaler environment, ensuring high-quality, ready-to-use data across the board.
  • Prebuilt SAP Business Data Cloud Intelligent Applications deliver instant, AI-powered business insights with minimal setup, accelerating decision-making and innovation.

 

Ultimately, SAP BDC helps organizations:

  • Streamline operations with advanced data pipelines
  • Accelerate innovation through AI and predictive analytics
  • Improve agility by enabling teams to respond to change quickly
  • Drive business growth by turning data into a competitive advantage

 

Happy Learning!

 

Swati Gawade-Shingade.

Cognizant technology Solutions.

You may also go through below blogs

SAP BDC for Dummies - SAP Community

SAP BDC Key Features - SAP Community

Deep Dive into SAP BDC Data products - SAP Community

entry.title: Data Lineage – Do it Yourself with SAP HANA and SAC
entry.content:
Management Summary 

  1. Data lineage is crucial for understanding the origin and usage of data – a central requirement for data governance, data quality, and efficient data management. 
  2. With SAP HANA and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), a cost-effective and quickly implementable solution for data lineage can be realized, as both products are already included in the licensing of many companies. 
  3. The Object Dependencies in SAP HANA provide comprehensive information about dependencies between tables, views, and other objects, which can be directly read in SAC via a live connection. 
  4. Thanks to the R-integration in SAC (e.g., with the R package "collapsibleTree"), an interactive tree representation is created, offering business users an intuitive and transparent overview of data flows and relationships. 
  5. This approach enables an automated, real-time view of data origin, improves the maintainability of reports and data models, and lays the foundation for reliable and data governance-compliant analytics applications.

Introduction

In modern data warehouse architectures, data lineage plays an increasingly important role. Companies want to trace where data comes from, how it is transformed, and in which reports it is ultimately used. Transparent data origin significantly contributes to data quality and governance. It also creates data understanding and facilitates the implementation of reporting requirements, especially in self-service environments.

Companies with an SAP tech stack are often familiar with the principle of data lineage from SAP BW, where data flows can be visualized via the data flow object. However, in modern system landscapes where SAP BW is combined with SAP HANA – for example, through hybrid architectures with native HANA views and BW objects – this visualization reaches its limits. In native HANA development, such visualization options are even completely missing.

Although established tools like Collibra or D-QUANTUM offer comprehensive lineage functions, they require additional licenses, implementation effort and a structuring of organizational process to get the full potential out of the tools. For many use cases – such as error analysis or the development of new requirements – a lighter solution is sufficient.

Therefore, we looked for a lean and quickly implementable alternative that supports development in complex system landscapes. Our goal: to automatically identify and visualize the dependencies of SAP HANA objects – without additional third-party tools.

In this blog post, we show how to implement a cost-effective and quick visualization of data lineage using SAP HANA Object Dependencies and a live connection to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). A special highlight: Through the integration of R in SAC (including the R package "collapsibleTree"), data origin is visualized in an interactive tree structure in an SAC story.

 

Motivation: Why Data Lineage?

The requirements for transparency, traceability, and efficiency in data architectures are increasing – especially in regulated and data-driven companies. Data lineage makes a decisive contribution here:

  • Transparency: Knowing the origin and usage of data creates trust and better decision-making foundations.
  • Data understanding: A clear overview of data flows facilitates both operation and the implementation of reporting and analysis requirements.
  • Maintainability: Changes in the data model can be better assessed if the affected downstream objects are known.
  • Compliance: Regulations like GDPR require traceable documentation of data processing.

Many companies already have some form of data lineage – but usually maintained manually by data engineers in PowerPoint, Excel, or Word. The result: high maintenance effort, outdated documentation, and lack of up-to-date information in ongoing operations.

Our solution is based on existing SAP HANA and SAC licenses and combines automated determination of data flows with an interactive representation through R integration. This creates a maintainable, always up-to-date, and interactive overview of data flows – without additional tools or costs.

 

Technical Background: SAP HANA Object Dependencies

SAP HANA provides Object Dependencies in the form of metadata tables and views, where relationships between different objects are stored. Here you can find information about which objects depend on and are linked to each other. A brief overview:

  • Data source: The Objects Dependencies View can be found in the HANA schema SYS under the name OBJECT_DEPENDENCIES.
  • Object types: Tables, views, stored procedures, etc.
  • Dependencies: Relationships between objects, e.g., which tables or views are used for an SAC report.
  • Usage: Supports impact and lineage analyses directly at the database level.

Through a live connection in SAP Analytics Cloud, this information can be queried and visualized in real-time.

Figure 1: Extract from the Object Dependencies | SELECT TOP 1000 * FROM SYS.OBJECT_DEPENDENCIES.

Implementation in SAP Analytics Cloud

To implement the data lineage solution in SAC, two prerequisites must be met:

  • Live connection to SAP HANA: With the HANA live connection the necessary metadata is read from HANA in real time to ensure that it is up to date. This live connection must be created.
  • R server configuration: An R package is used for visualization. The use of R must be activated in SAC.

The necessary steps in order to create the lineage visualization can be summarized as follows:

  • Data preparation in SAP HANA
    • Preparation of metadata: For optimal visualization, the metadata is prepared, e.g., filtering object types, enriching descriptions.
    • Provision as a calculation view: The data is prepared as a calculation view as a basis for the SAC story.
  • Establishing a live connection to HANA
    • Configure live connection: Set up the HANA connection in SAC under Connections → Live Data Connection.
    • Create data model in SAC: Reference the live data model to the created view/table.
  • Activate R integration in SAC
    • Configure R server: Specify the R server in SAC administration under System Configuration (either own server or the environment provided by SAP).
    • Create R scripts: In a story or an analytic application, the R package "collapsibleTree" can be loaded using the R widget function.
  • Create data lineage visualization with "collapsibleTree"
    • Pass data to R: Load the HANA table or view data into an R-compatible table structure via the R script in SAC.
    • Generate tree structure: Create an interactive tree representation with collapsibleTree::collapsibleTree(...) or a similar function.
    • Embed result: The generated graphic appears directly in the SAC story within the R widget and can be filtered and extended as needed.

Results and Benefits

  • Quick & cost-effective implementation: In this case, the customer already had SAP HANA and SAC licensed, so no additional investments were necessary.
  • Automation: Dependencies are read directly from SAP HANA Object Dependencies, eliminating the need for a separate ETL process or manual maintenance.
  • Interactive representation: Users can click through the tree structure and trace relationships between objects.

Figure 2: Representation of the data lineage within a SAC story.

Best Practices & Tips

  • Performance: For very large data volumes, it is advisable to perform aggregation or filtering in HANA beforehand and persist it.
  • Naming conventions: Consistent naming for tables and views makes the tree diagram easier to read.
  • Limitations: Complex procedures or dynamic SQL are not always fully recognized – additional manual mapping may be necessary.
  • Visualization in R: For data lineage representation, we use the R package collapsibleTree, which is included in the SAP-provided R runtime environment (packages in the SAP R server environment). It can be used directly and free of charge in SAC without additional infrastructure. For extended visualization options, an own R server with additional packages can alternatively be connected.

 

Conclusion and Outlook

The visualization of data lineage in SAP Analytics Cloud using SAP HANA Object Dependencies and the R package "collapsibleTree" is a lean and cost-effective solution for companies that want to make their data origin traceable.

Thanks to the live data connection between HANA and SAC, no complicated interfaces or additional licenses are needed. With the out-of-the-box R integration and the interactive widgets of SAC, the origin and usage of tables can be traced in detail with just a few clicks.

The presented solution offers an efficient way, minimum in the short term, to provide developers and business units with more transparency about data flows. In the medium to long term, the use of specialized data governance solutions like Collibra or D-Quantum is recommended to centrally manage lineage, documentation, and responsibilities.

 

Questions, Feedback, and Contact

We are happy to answer questions and engage in further discussions – either in the comments or through direct contact.

Do you need more information?

  • If further technical information is desired (e.g., configuration of the R server, scripting in SAC, performance optimization, manual mapping), let us know!
  • We are happy to dive deeper into the implementation details in a personal conversation.

We look forward to the exchange and are happy to provide further advice and implementation in the area of SAP Data & Analytics.

Authors:

Oliver Bulla (@OliverBulla), Senior Data Intelligence Consultant, specializing in SAP solutions, oliver.bulla@wavestone.com  

Christian Bantle (@christianbantle), Senior Data Intelligence Consultant, specializing in SAP solutions, christian.bantle@wavestone.com

(Disclaimer: This blog post is based on personal experiences and projects. The screenshots and examples shown are exemplary and may vary depending on the system landscape.)

entry.title: What's New in SAP Analytics Cloud Modeling Extensions & Integration QRC3 2025 Release
entry.content:
Purpose

Hello SAP Community Colleagues,

In QRC3 2025, we have an action-packed list of new features that have now been made available in the modeling area of SAP Analytics Cloud, within Business Data Cloud!

Overview

Learn more about these new features here:

  1. A new formula called WAVG (Weighted Average)

  2. First, Last and Average including unbooked data exception aggregation.

  3. Data Export API – Delta Aggregation.

 

  1. New formula - WAVG  (Weighted Average)

A new formula has been introduced into the modeler, called WAVG.  This formula calculates the weighted average of a member, based on the value of the corresponding members assigned weight.  It can be used in standard and account models.

How Weighted Average is calculated:

 

Dimension 

Price

Stock

Price * Stock

Bread

2

10

20

Bread

3

20

60

Bread

4

30

120

Total

8

60

200

Table 1: Table containing product, price and stock values

 

Table 1 shows a simple list of products with various prices and stock amounts.

To calculate the Average Price, use the following calculation:

(2+3+4)/3 = 3

To calculate the Weighted Average Price, use the following calculation: (2*10) + (3*20) + (4*30) / (10 + 20 + 30 ) = 200 / 60 = 3.33

The weighted average calculation can provide a more accurate result, based on the given weight, compared to an average calculation.

Syntax:

WAVG([Measure] or [Account Member], [Assigned Weight], [Dimension 1], [Dimension 2]... [Dimension 10])

For example:

Figure 1: Sample WAVG Syntax

The above WAVG formula calculates the weighted average of [Price] using [Volume] as the assigned weight, for a given Date and Product.

Up to 10 dimensions can be used within the WAVG formula.

Note that input enablement on cells containing this calculated measure is available on leaf members only, which is the lowest level of the hierarchy.  It is planned to make input enablement available on other members in the future.

2.  First, Last and Average Exception Aggregation including Unbooked Data

You can now compute first, last and average exception aggregation including unbooked data using a single dimension on a base measure or base account with these three new exception aggregation values:

  • Average incl. Unbooked calculates the average of all aggregated values, including unbooked values.
  • First incl. Unbooked shows the first (oldest) value in the selected period, including unbooked values.
  • Last incl. Unbooked shows the last (most recent) value in the selected period, including unbooked values.

Figure 2: New exception aggregations in modeler

These new exception aggregations are supported in the standard and account model and can help to provide more accurate results on aggregated data.

Average including unbooked exception aggregation example:

Figure 3: Illustration on how Average incl. Unbooked now considers all months in period, instead of just months containing booked values

In the above example, an Average incl. Unbooked exception aggregation is applied to a base measure.  The total in Q1 is 100, in Q2 is 200, in Q3 is 300 and in Q4 is 400.

When booked values are only considered, the average is the sum of these values, divided by the number of booked entries, i.e. (100+200+300+400)/4 months=250.

When considering unbooked data, a more accurate average exception aggregation can now be calculated. 

i.e. (100+200+300+400)/12 months = 83.33

First including unbooked exception aggregation example:

Figure 4: Illustration on how First incl. Unbooked now considers all months in period, instead of just months containing booked values

Figure 4 shows an example of how First Incl. Unbooked exception aggregation now considers unbooked values in the first period, compared to when using First exception aggregation, that defaults to booked values.  Should this example show an entry for February, the top level of the hierarchy will still show unbooked values, as January is now considered within the formula even though it contains no data.  This provides a more accurate First exception aggregation result of entries for a given period. 

Figure 5: Illustration on how Last incl. Unbooked now considers unbooked values for a given period

Figure 5 shows how Last incl. Unbooked exception aggregation compares to Last exception aggregation.  Last exception aggregation contains 400 for October.  As this is the last period that contains booked values, results are seen at the top level of the hierarchy.  In contrast, Last incl. Unbooked also contains 400 for October, however, the last period is December, which contains an unbooked value.  This unbooked value is therefore seen at the top level of the hierarchy for that period, providing a more accurate result for the Last aggregation.

3.  Data Export API – Fact Data Delta Aggregation

The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of aggregated delta of fact data, using a new ‘FactDataAggregation‘ endpoint. 

This means that changed fact data can now be aggregated and then exported, compared to exporting all changed fact data.  This feature compliments how S/4 consumes aggregated fact data.

Modelers can also access this feature within the API Subcriptions tab in their model.

Figure 6: Fact Data Delta Aggregation entity set within the Create Subscriptions area of the model

An example of how Delta Aggregation works:

Account

Product

Sales

Account1

Water

100

Account1

Juice

150

Account2

Water

200

Account2

Juice

150

Table 2: Accounts 1 & 2 contains Products and Sales.

Table 2 shows Account1 & Account2 contains 2 products at various sales values.

Account

Sales

Account1

250

Account2

350

Table 3: Aggregated values of Account1 & Account2

Let’s modify the sales values for both accounts:

Account

Product

Sales

Account1

Water

110

Account1

Juice

80

Account2

Water

75

Table 4: Sales values have changed, reflecting changed fact data.

The sales value for Water in Account1 has been change from 100 to 110.

The sales value for Juice in Account1 has been change from 150 to 80.

The sales value for Water in Account2 has been change from 200 to 75.

There is no change for Juice in Account2.

The aggregated fact data values are therefore calculated as follows:

Account

Sales

Account1

((110 - 100) + (80 - 150)) = -60

Account2

((75-200) + (150 – 150)) = -125

Table 5: How the aggregated values are calculated

These are the values that will be exported using the ‘FactDataAggregation‘ endpoint or by using the Fact Data Delta Aggregation entity set in the API Subscriptions section of the model.

Conclusion

In summary, the following new features and updates have been introduced to the Modeling Extensions and Integration areas of SAP Analytics Cloud, within Business Data Cloud, as part of QRC3 2025 release.

  1. A new formula, called WAVG, calculates the weighted average of a member, based on the value of the corresponding members assigned weight. 
  2. Three new exception aggregations can be applied to base measures and base accounts. 
    • First incl. Unbooked shows the first (oldest) value in the selected period, including unbooked values.
    • Last incl. Unbooked shows the last (newest) value in the selected period, including unbooked values.
    • Average incl. Unbooked calculates the average of all aggregated values, including unbooked values.
  3. The Data Export API has been extended to support the export of aggregated delta of fact data using a new ‘FactDataAggregation‘ endpoint.  Modelers can also use the new Fata Data Delta Aggregation entity set name in the API Subscriptions tab of the model.

If you have any questions, feel free to comment below or post a question to our SAP Analytics Cloud Questions & Answers forum.

See this SAP Knowledge Base Article if you’d like to learn more about FastTrack and Quarterly Release Cycle releases.

For further information, visit our SAP Analytics Cloud Community pages to find more product information, best practices, and more. 

To find out more about QRC release dates, see SAP Analytics Cloud tenants on Quarterly Release Cycle (QRC) updates in 2025.

Check out our SAP Road Map Explorer to see more upcoming features of SAP Analytics Cloud.

Thanks for reading!

entry.title: New Alert Helps You Manage Data Change Logs Easily in SAC Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Keeping your planning environment healthy just got easier. In the QRC3 2025 release, SAP Analytics Cloud introduces Data Change Log Notifications — a new feature that gives you heads-up into the size of your data change logs before they become a problem.

Overview

You can now configure alerts to notify you when a data change log reaches a specific size threshold. This is especially useful for large, collaborative planning environments where continuous planning operations and publishing can lead to data change log growing quickly.

With these alerts in place, you gain:

  • Increased transparency into model health
  • Proactive control to reduce log size before issues arise
  • Fewer disruptions from blocked publishing due to oversized logs

 

Configuration Management

Administration Notification Configuration

Administrators or users with the right permissions can configure data change log alerts by going to:

System > Administration > Notifications > Data Change Log Notifications

 

From here, you can:

  • Set a custom size threshold
  • Choose how notifications are delivered (in-app, email, or both)
  • Define the recipients who should be notified

Tip: To avoid spamming users, it's recommended to set the threshold to at least 60%. By default, it's set to 80%.

 

User Preferences for Email Notifications

Users with Delete permission for the Data Change Log object type or those explicitly added to the custom recipient list can manage their personal email preferences via:

Profile Settings > User Preferences > Data Change Log Notifications

From there, they can choose to enable or disable email alerts as needed.

 

The Result

When the data change log of any model reaches the threshold that has been defined, notifications are automatically triggered.

When you receive the notification, it’s recommended to reduce the log size as soon as possible to avoid the potential disruptions when publishing data. You can do this by navigating to Data Change Log, where you can filter and delete the log records easily using the flexible filtering options.  If you would like to keep a backup before deleting, simply export the log records first.

 

Conclusion

With this new notification capability, you can monitor the health of your data change log more effectively and keep things running smoothly.

entry.title: SAP 分析云经验分享：如何“点对点”地批量修改日历事件的上下文
entry.content:
一、介绍  

在数字化转型加速演进、企业对敏捷运营与智能决策需求持续攀升的当下，SAP 分析云凭借其强大的综合能力，正成为企业赋能业务管理与战略决策的核心平台。它集数据可视化、预测分析、规划及协作于一体，不仅帮助企业洞察趋势、优化流程，更为组织打造出一套覆盖全局的智能化运营体系。 

在 SAP 分析云中，日历功能被广泛用于企业计划、事件安排、任务追踪及跨部门协作，但其上下文批量修改能力仍存在明显短板。 

例如，当企业根据标准化模板生成一个规模较大的流程后，如果后续需要针对某一关键维度（如时间、区域等）进行整体性调整，往往只能通过“编辑事件”中的“替换上下文”来实现，但这种方法意味着原有的全部上下文信息会被一并清空，导致企业需耗费人力重新配置所有维度，容易引发管理上的不一致与风险。 

针对这一问题，我开发了基于 SAC 日历 API 脚本的故事应用，专注于实现“点对点”的上下文批量修改功能。用户只需输入一个流程的 ID，即可完整展现该流程及其所有子流程、子事件的层级结构，精准锁定需要修改的范围。接着，可根据实际业务需要灵活选择目标模型、待修改的上下文维度，并进一步指定新成员，实现对指定维度的批量更新，同时保证其他维度信息原封不动地保留在流程上下文中。

这项能力尤其适用于以下场景： 
• 基于标准模板生成流程后，需对某一单一维度进行快速统一调整。
• 在组织架构或战略方向变更时，对流程的上下文进行局部修订，而无需重新初始化全部配置。

 

二、如何使用“批量修改日历事件上下文”应用 

使用该故事应用前可在该故事页面查看相关故事应用的使用说明。  

1、要执行此操作，您需要具备以下权限 

  • 公共文件的“读”权限 

  • 计划模型的“读”权限 

2、请按照以下步骤获取父日历流程的事件 ID：  

  • 选中事件后，点击右上角的“详细信息”，在弹出菜单栏的右上角，点击“更多”，然后点击“事件设置” 

  • 如果未勾选“允许外部 API 访问”选项，请勾选该选项。  

  • 然后点击“显示详情”以查看并复制事件 ID。

3、将事件 ID 粘贴到文本框中，并点击“Confirm”，之后会在下一栏中显示出进程及其子事件的结构。 

4、在下一栏中选择想要修改的范围，并点击“Confirm”。但请注意，并不是所有选中的事件都一定会被修改，这取决于这一事件是否使用到了你之后选择的模型，以及是否包括了你之后选择的维度。 

5、在下一栏中选择一个你想要修改的上下文所引用的模型，并点击“Confirm”。 

6、在下一栏中选择你想要修改的维度，并点击“Confirm”。 

7、在下一栏中，请分别修改维度中的成员，方法如下： 

  • 单击某一维度。 

  • 按如下示意操作。 

8、将所有维度都设置好后，点击“Confirm”。 

9、在修改完成后，右侧栏会显示日志。 

10、若想要修改其他子事件，请重新从步骤4开始。 

 

三、注意事项  

无法替换数据锁定任务、数据操作任务、多操作任务、输入任务。

 

四、代码实现 

在介绍之前，我们先明确三种概念。 

维度（Dimension）：模型中的一个特定方面或分类依据。 

成员（Member）：在某个维度下的具体实例或分类项。 

筛选器（Filter）：由一个维度及其对应的一些成员所构成的组合，用于对数据进行筛选和限定，以便聚焦于特定的分析范围或数据子集。 

接下来将对主要的实现逻辑进行介绍，主要逻辑步骤如下： 

1、变量与页面初始化 

在实现该功能之前，需要在故事应用中配置“日历集成”，并完成变量的初始化。以下是部分关键变量的说明：

datasource // 所选中model的datasource对象 
eventsIds // 流程及其子项的id 
isEventsAllSelected// 是否选中了所有的事件（用于全选按钮） 
modelId // 所选中model的id 
selectedFilters // 所选择的筛选器；如选择维度A，那么所有事件中与A相关的筛选器都会被添加到这个数组 
toBeModifiedEvents // 选中的事件 
//以下两个变量用于模拟二维数组，目的是存储每个model id下都有什么dimension id 
uniqueModelDimensionId_1  //  这个数组存储model id 
uniqueModelDimensionId_2   //这个数组存储dimension id

 在页面初始化中，设置了系统消息提示类型。 

2、校验并获取流程及其子项 

//获取event ID。Get the event ID. 
var userInput_processID = InputField_1.getValue(); 
var processEvent = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(userInput_processID); 
//如果获取不到对象，则报错。 If the object cannot be obtained, an error will be reported. 
if (processEvent === undefined) { 
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Please enter a correct ID."); 
    Application.hideBusyIndicator(); 
    return; 
}

使用队列进行广度优先遍历。 

  • 同时使用两个队列，idQueue用于存储event id，spaceQueue用于记录深度，以便后续能更好地显示层次结构 
  • 对每个事件获取其对象，并将其属性添加到复选框中。 
  • 若这个事件同时是流程，将它的子项加入到队列。 
//BFS  
var idQueue = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
var spaceQueue = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
idQueue.push(processEvent.getId()); 
//spaceQueue以字符的形式标明了目前遍历到第几层。 spaceQueue indicates the current level of traversal in the form of characters. 
spaceQueue.push(""); 
while (idQueue.length > 0) { 
    var currentId = idQueue.shift(); 
    var currentSpace = spaceQueue.shift(); 
    var currentEvent = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(currentId); 
    if (currentEvent !== undefined) { 
        CheckboxGroup_1.addItem(currentId, currentSpace + currentEvent.getName()); 
        eventsIds.push(currentId); 
        if (currentEvent.getType() === CalendarTaskType.Process) { 
            var currentProcess = cast(Type.CalendarProcess, currentEvent); 
            var childrenIds = currentProcess.getChildren(); 
            for (var i = 0; i < childrenIds.length; i++) { 
                idQueue.push(childrenIds[i]); 
                spaceQueue.push(currentSpace + "-"); 
            } 
        } 
    } 
}

3、用户选择事件后，获取所有被选中的事件里面互不相同的filter 

  • 获取到选择的事件 
  • 对每个选择的事件，遍历其filter，并维护到一个不重复的数组中。 
  • 如果数组为空，即找不到任何filter，则报错。 
//获取到选择的事件 Obtain the selected events. 
toBeModifiedEvents = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarEvent); 
var toBeModifiedEventsID = CheckboxGroup_1.getSelectedKeys(); 
var uniqueFilters = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarContextFilter); 

//获取到有几种不同的筛选器 Obtain the unique filters. 
for (var i = 0; i < toBeModifiedEventsID.length; i++) { 
    var event = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(toBeModifiedEventsID[i]); 
    toBeModifiedEvents.push(event); 
    // 获取当前事件的筛选器数组 Obtain the array of filters of the current event. 
    var filters = event.getContextFilters();  
    if (filters === undefined) { 
        continue; 
    } 
    console.log(filters); 
    // 遍历每个筛选器 Traverse each filter. 
    for (var j = 0; j < filters.length; j++) { 
        var filter = filters[j]; 
        if (!uniqueFilters.includes(filter)) { 
            uniqueFilters.push(filter); 
        } 
    } 
} 
//如果找不到任何筛选器，则报错。If no filter is found, an error will be reported. 
if (uniqueFilters.length === 0) { 
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "No context was found."); 
    Application.hideBusyIndicator(); 
    return; 
}

4、获取每个model Id下的dimension Id，以及model Id与model name的对应关系 

  • 通过之前维护的不重复filter数组中获取到每个model id下的dimension id。 
  • 获取到每个model对应的datasource来得到该model的名称；在这里，我使用了一个hidden table。 
var uniqueModelId = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
for (var m = 0; m < uniqueFilters.length; m++) { 
    var modelId_ = uniqueFilters[m].members[0].modelId; 
    var dimensionId = uniqueFilters[m].members[0].dimensionId; 
    if (!(uniqueModelDimensionId_1.includes(modelId_) && uniqueModelDimensionId_2.includes(dimensionId))) { 
        uniqueModelDimensionId_1.push(modelId_); 
        uniqueModelDimensionId_2.push(dimensionId); 
    } 
    if (!uniqueModelId.includes(modelId_)) { 
        uniqueModelId.push(modelId_); 
    } 
} 

var temp1 = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
var temp2 = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 

for (var n = 0; n < uniqueModelId.length; n++) { 
    var modelId__ = uniqueModelId[n]; 
    Table_1.setModel(modelId__); 
    datasource = Table_1.getDataSource(); 
    temp1.push(modelId__); 
    temp2.push(datasource.getInfo().modelName); 
} 

for (var o = 0; o < temp1.length; o++) { 
    RadioButtonGroup_1.addItem(temp1[o], temp2[o]); 
}

5、用户选择某个model后，获取dimension id与description的对应关系 

  • 将Calendar API的dimension id与datasource的dimension id进行匹配，获取到每个dimension的description 
modelId = RadioButtonGroup_1.getSelectedKey(); 
datasource = Table_1.getDataSource(); 
var dimensions = datasource.getDimensions(); 
var descriptions = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
for (var h = 0; h < uniqueModelDimensionId_1.length; h++) { 
    if (uniqueModelDimensionId_1[h] === modelId) { 
        for (var j = 0; j < dimensions.length; j++) { 
            if (dimensions[j].id === uniqueModelDimensionId_2[h]) { 
                descriptions.push(dimensions[j].description); 
                break; 
            } 
        } 
        console.log("error, dimension id dismatch"); 
    } else { 
        descriptions.push("1"); //占位 
    } 
} 

for (var i = 0; i < uniqueModelDimensionId_1.length; i++) { 
    if (uniqueModelDimensionId_1[i] === modelId) { 
        CheckboxGroup_2.addItem(uniqueModelDimensionId_2[i], uniqueModelDimensionId_2[i] + " " + descriptions[i]); 
    } 
}

6、用户选择dimension后，通过已选择的dimension id来获取到具体需要修改哪些filter 

var selectedDimensions = CheckboxGroup_2.getSelectedKeys(); 
selectedFilters = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarContextFilter); 
for (var k = 0; k < toBeModifiedEvents.length; k++) { 
    var filters = toBeModifiedEvents[k].getContextFilters(); 
    for (var m = 0; m < filters.length; m++) { 
        if (selectedDimensions.includes(filters[m].members[0].dimensionId) && filters[m].members[0].modelId === modelId && !selectedFilters.includes(filters[m])){ 
            selectedFilters.push(filters[m]); 
        } 
    } 
}

7、将具体需要修改的filter添加到datasource中，以便能够在filter line中显示 

  • Version维度会默认作为datasource的filter，为了避免这一情况，预先将Version加入到Table的列中。 
var dimensions = datasource.getDimensions(); 
for (var s = 0; s < dimensions.length; s++) { 
    if (dimensions[s] == "Version") { 
        Table_1.addDimensionToColumns("Version"); 
        break; 
    } 
} 

for (var o = 0; o < selectedDimensions.length; o++) { 
    for (var u = 0; u < selectedFilters.length; u++) { 
        if (selectedFilters[u].members[0].dimensionId === selectedDimensions[o]) { 
            datasource.setDimensionFilter(selectedDimensions[o], selectedFilters[u].members); 
        } 
    } 
}

8、删除旧的filter并添加新的filter 

  • 首先，对之前存储的需要修改的filter数组进行去重处理 
  • 删除旧的filter 
  • 构造新的Context Filter 
  • 加入新的filter 
  • 添加日志 
var dimensions = datasource.getDimensions(); 
//selectedFilters 去重 Remove duplicates from selected filters.
var selectedFiltersNoRepeat = ArrayUtils.create(Type.CalendarContextFilter); 
for (var v = 0; v < selectedFilters.length; v++) {
    var curMembers  = selectedFilters[v].members;
    var curIds      = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);
    for (var i = 0; i < curMembers.length; i++) {
        curIds.push(curMembers[i].id);
    }
    var isDuplicate = false;
    for (var c = 0; c < selectedFiltersNoRepeat.length; c++) {
        var existMembers = selectedFiltersNoRepeat[c].members;
        var existIds     = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string);
        for (var j = 0; j < existMembers.length; j++) {
            existIds.push(existMembers[j].id);
        }
        if (curIds.length !== existIds.length) {
	    continue;
	}
        curIds.sort();
        existIds.sort();
        var allMatch = true;
        for (var h = 0; h < curIds.length; h++) {
            if (curIds[h] !== existIds[h]) {
                allMatch = false;
                break;
            }
        }
        if (allMatch) {
            isDuplicate = true;
            break;
        }
    }
    if (!isDuplicate) {
        selectedFiltersNoRepeat.push(selectedFilters[v]);
    }
}

for (var q = 0; q < selectedFiltersNoRepeat.length; q++) { 
    //selectedFilter是目前需要修改的筛选器 selectedFilter is the filter that currently needs to be modified. 
    var selectedFilter = selectedFiltersNoRepeat[q]; 
    //复制一份变量，避免出现意外情况 Make a copy of the variable to avoid unexpected situations 
    var modifiedFilter = selectedFilter; 
    var dimensionId = modifiedFilter.members[0].dimensionId; 
    var newMemberInfo = ArrayUtils.create(Type.MemberInfo); 
    //构造一个原有members的字符串，以供日志使用 Construct a string of the original members for logging purposes. 
    var oldMembers = ""; 
    for (var r = 0; r < modifiedFilter.members.length; r++) { 
        oldMembers = oldMembers + " " + modifiedFilter.members[r].description; 
    } 
    //从datasource中获取到用户已经在filter line中修改好的filter Obtain the filter that the user has already modified in the filter line from the datasource. 
    var unspecifiedFilterValues = datasource.getDimensionFilters(dimensionId); 

    //删除旧的筛选器。remove old filter 
    var recordModifiedEvents = ArrayUtils.create(Type.integer);  
    for (var j = 0; j < toBeModifiedEvents.length; j++) { 
        if (toBeModifiedEvents[j].removeContextFilter(selectedFilter)) { 
            recordModifiedEvents.push(j); 

        } 
    }	 

    //构建新的member info Construct the new member info. 
    for (var m = 0; m < unspecifiedFilterValues.length; m++) { 
        if (unspecifiedFilterValues[m].type == "Single") { 
            var filterValue = cast(Type.SingleFilterValue, unspecifiedFilterValues[m]); 
            var thisMemberInfo = datasource.getMember(dimensionId, filterValue.value); 
            newMemberInfo.push(thisMemberInfo); 
    } 
    if (unspecifiedFilterValues[m].type == "Multiple") { 
        var multipleFilterValue = cast(Type.MultipleFilterValue, unspecifiedFilterValues[m]); 
        var tempValues = multipleFilterValue.values; 
        for (var u = 0; u < tempValues.length; u++) { 
            var thisMemberInfo2 = datasource.getMember(dimensionId, tempValues[u]); 
            newMemberInfo.push(thisMemberInfo2); 
        } 
    } 
} 

    //替换掉原来的member info Replace the original member info. 
    modifiedFilter.members = newMemberInfo; 

    //构造一个新members的字符串，以供日志使用 Construct a new string of members for logging purposes. 
    var newMembers = ""; 
    for (var e = 0; e < modifiedFilter.members.length; e++) { 
        newMembers = newMembers + " " + modifiedFilter.members[e].description; 
    } 

    //增加新的filter，并添加日志 Add a new filter and log the action. 
    for (var k = 0; k < recordModifiedEvents.length; k++) { 
        toBeModifiedEvents[recordModifiedEvents[k]].addContextFilter(modifiedFilter); 
        ListBox_1.addItem(toBeModifiedEvents[recordModifiedEvents[k]].getName()+" ["+modifiedFilter.members[0].dimensionId + "] " + oldMembers + " ->" + newMembers); 
    }
}

 

五、总结 

本文主要分享了我开发“批量修改日历事件上下文”故事应用的经验。如果您也遇到了类似的问题，希望可以给您启发。

entry.title: Sneak Peek in to SAP Analytics Cloud release for Q3 2025
entry.content:
We have a very special AI focused release coming your way this quarter. In this blog we give you a sneak peek into our Top 5 features in SAP Analytics Cloud for QRC3 2025. A full list of what is coming can be found on our Roadmap Explorer.  Let's dive in!

AI-assisted advanced formula generation

This quarter we bring you a number of exciting new AI-assisted features and we will start by looking at AI-assisted advanced formula generation. Within the advanced formula editor this feature utilizes generative AI to create advanced formula script logic from natural language comments, making the process of developing data actions easier, quicker, and more efficient.

This feature can also generate descriptions of existing advanced formulas generated automatically in natural language, reducing time and complexity associated with creating in-line script documentation.

 

AI-assisted chart summary

Continuing with AI, next up we have the new AI-Assisted Chart Summary, which leverages generative AI to automatically generate concise, human-readable summaries of SAP Analytics Cloud charts embedded in your PowerPoint presentations. Whether you're preparing for a meeting or sharing insights with stakeholders, this feature helps you communicate key takeaways faster and more clearly.

 

 

AI-assisted commenting

Our third AI-assisted feature enables users to streamline efforts to summarize, translate, and interpret comments with the table and comment widget. This includes shortening and simplifying long-form commentary into highlights, summarizing data point comment threads and aggregating data point comments from descendant cells. These features will also translate this summarization and aggregation to the user’s language specified in their profile. When authoring a new comment, the user will have the ability to rephrase comments

 

Home Page renewal

This release introduces a new and improved home page for SAP Analytics Cloud users. New cards options, alongside existing ones, offer quick access to relevant tools, tasks, resources, and insights. They are available for users to quickly and easily personalize their home screen layout and features with minimal effort, further empowering them to create a tailored and efficient user experience. The new home screen aims to streamline workflows, increase productivity, and foster a stronger association with innovation and improved usability for SAP Analytics Cloud users.

Existing cards remain supported like data change insight, calendar tasks, recent files, and featured files, while new cards become available like just ask, on boarding, quick action, resources, and many more.

 

 

Optimized table experience

Inspired by numerous requests from our influence portal, this quarter we introduce a new optimized table experience.

The optimized table experience provides interface consistency with chart widgets and includes all features of classic tables. Additional functionality includes undo/redo options, mobile compatibility, expanded tooltip settings, improved data synchronization, and a new intuitive builder panel designed for customizing layouts, assigning dimensions, adding calculations, and filtering data. As this is a wide topic it covers 6 new innovations on the Roadmap explorer listed below:

  • Blending for a table with support of sort, rank, totals, and custom order
  • New builder panel
  • Option to turn on and off the Thresholds tooltip when hovering over a data cell in a table
  • New client calculations panel
  • New member selector
  • Sort and Rank enhancements

 

There are plenty more exciting deliverables coming your way this quarter and we will be taking a deeper dive into these items in our What’s New video and blog series so stay tuned. For a full list of all features coming in QRC3 2025 for SAP Analytics Cloud check out the Roadmap Explorer  and the What's New Viewer

Want to experience new and existing features for yourself? Take the leap and start your journey towards making data-driven decisions with confidence by signing up for a free trial, today.

entry.title: Session 5 Recap & Highlights - Planning Your Transition Paths to SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
Let's review the key insights from our session on 'Planning your transition path to SAP Business Data Cloud'.

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) marks a transformative approach to enterprise data management and utilization. This comprehensive SaaS platform centralizes and governs SAP data assets while integrating effortlessly with external data sources. BDC is designed to tackle the increasing complexity of today's data environments and meet the critical demand for AI-enabled, real-time analytical capabilities.

 

Customer Needs Driving the Transition

Organizations face several critical challenges that SAP BDC is designed to address:
Data Accessibility and Context: Companies struggle with extracting data from SAP systems while maintaining business semantics and context. When data is moved to external platforms, valuable business meaning is often lost, requiring significant time and resources to rebuild .

AI and Analytics Acceleration: Modern businesses need high-quality, AI-ready data to drive reliable and accurate artificial intelligence applications. The traditional approach of fragmented data silos impedes innovation and limits the potential for advanced analytics .

Simplified Data Landscape: Multiple tools, manual processes, and inconsistent data preparation tasks slow the development of advanced analytics and AI capabilities. Organizations seek a unified platform that can eliminate these inefficiencies.

Real-time Insights: The demand for faster time-to-insights requires modern infrastructure capable of supporting real-time decision-making processes across all business functions.

 

Adoption Journey and Transition Approaches
SAP has defined a structured approach to BDC adoption that allows organizations to progress at their own pace while preserving existing investments. The transition follows a three-phase methodology: Lift, Shift, and Innovate.

 

Evolving Beyond SAP Data and Analytics Portfolio

SAP customers utilizing systems like SAP BW (Business Warehouse), SAP HANA, SAP Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud are increasingly seeking pathways to modernize their data environments. The introduction of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) represents a major shift, offering organizations an integrated, cloud-native platform capable of unifying data from SAP and non-SAP sources, enabling advanced analytics, and powering AI-driven insights in real time.

Migrating from SAP BW and SAP HANA
Many enterprises have long relied on SAP BW for critical reporting and data warehousing needs. However, with SAP BW 7.5 reaching end of mainstream maintenance in 2027, businesses are tasked with deciding between maintaining aging systems or embracing cloud-ready solutions. BDC allows organizations to lift and shift their existing BW environments—including critical data models and business logic—directly into the cloud, often through SAP BW/4HANA private cloud edition. This preserves past investments while immediately unlocking scalable data products, improved governance, and seamless integration with SAP Datasphere and Databricks for analytics and AI scenarios. SAP HANA customers similarly benefit from BDC’s cloud-native architecture, which supports both structured and unstructured data, and offers scalable compute and flexible storage options for modern workloads.
 

 

Transitioning from SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud
With SAP BDC, customers currently operating SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud can expect a smooth, phased transition. BDC unifies these solutions into a single environment, streamlining workflows and reducing silos. Organizations leverage their existing data pipelines and analytics use cases - with features like zero-copy integration and data product generators - while quickly gaining access to enhanced AI, collaboration tools, and cross-platform interoperability. This means existing assets and semantic models in SAP Datasphere or Analytics Cloud can be retained and enriched rather than rebuilt, simplifying governance and accelerating time to value.
 
 
Key Benefits and Approach
The move to SAP Business Data Cloud is designed to minimize disruption. SAP provides a structured, stepwise migration methodology focused on:
  • Data Continuity: Preserving historical data and business rule integrity.
  • Operational Stability: Supporting parallel operations and robust fallback options during migration.
  • Capability Development: Offering training and resources so teams can maximize the value of BDC features.
  • Unified Data Governance: Centralizing oversight and compliance across all SAP and external data sources.

 

Strategic Planning Resources

It provides clear, concise answers to the most common technical and strategic questions architects encounter, such as how BDC unifies and governs SAP and third-party data, supports semantic modeling, and aligns with existing SAP environments like SAP Datasphere, SAP Analytics Cloud, and SAP BW.

It provides a centralized platform where architects can explore missions, reference architectures, and best practice guides tailored to the unique challenges of data platform modernization. Through curated use cases and real-world implementation patterns, the Discovery Center clarifies how SAP BDC unifies SAP and non-SAP data, streamlines data integration, and supports advanced analytics and AI. Architects can leverage solution diagrams, architecture blueprints, and tools in the Discovery Center to design resilient, scalable BDC environments.

The SAP Architecture Centre is a strategic hub for enterprise architects navigating the transition to SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC). It offers in-depth reference architectures, solution diagrams, and best practice guides specifically designed to address the complex requirements of modern data management and cloud adoption.

 

Implementation Support

The Accelerator Hub offers immediate access to an extensive library of ready-to-use integration components, APIs, and architectural templates that simplify the creation and deployment of cloud data solutions designed for SAP's dynamic platform ecosystem. This centralized resource enables architects to rapidly identify, assess, and test APIs along with Data Product and Data Package elements specifically for S/4HANA Private Cloud environments, significantly reducing the challenges commonly encountered during cloud migration and hybrid integration projects.
 

 

The SAP Roadmap Explorer is a powerful tool that helps enterprise architects plan their transition to SAP Business Data Cloud with greater clarity and confidence. It provides a clear view of current features and future innovations related to BDC, allowing architects to understand what’s available now and what’s coming soon. This helps them align technical plans with business goals and make informed decisions about timing, dependencies, and integration points. Overall, the SAP Roadmap Explorer gives architects the insight they need to design a well-structured, future-ready path to SAP Business Data Cloud.

 

Technology Capability Model in LeanIX

 

LeanIX’s Technology Capability Model (TCM) provides a framework for:
  • Current state assessment of existing technology landscapes
  • Target architecture design for future state planning
  • Transformation roadmap development with clear milestones and dependencies
  • Governance structure establishment for implementation oversight

 

Next Steps and Way Forward
Immediate Actions
1. Assess current SAP BW environment using SAP’s free assessment service (SAP Migration Assessment)
2. Evaluate transition readiness through the BDC Discovery Workshop
3. Develop stakeholder alignment across business and IT teams
Medium-term Planning
1. Design target architecture using LeanIX and SAP Architecture Center resources
2. Create detailed migration roadmap with phased approach
3. Establish governance framework for ongoing transformation management
Long-term Vision
1. Implement AI/ML capabilities through Databricks integration
2. Adopt Intelligent Applications for accelerated business value
3. Optimize data product economy for reusable, scalable data assets

The transition to SAP Business Data Cloud represents more than a technical migration - it’s a strategic transformation that positions organizations for the AI-driven future of business. With SAP’s structured approach of Land, Expand, and Adopt, organizations can preserve existing investments while gaining access to cutting-edge capabilities. The comprehensive ecosystem of resources, tools, and professional services ensures that organizations have the support needed to navigate this critical transformation successfully.
With proper planning, stakeholder alignment, and strategic execution, the move to SAP Business Data Cloud can unlock significant business value and competitive advantage in an increasingly data-driven marketplace.
 

Note: Slides from the session and the recording would be only available to the registered attendees. So if you have not registered, please register now using the link - Architecting Your SAP Business Data Cloud Journey – From Data to Intelligence!

 

Special thanks to...

@PaulKurchina  @Timo  @Gaurish-Dessai  @ralph_richter  @NaveenDumpa

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Experience Sharing: How to Batch Edit the Context of Calendar Events
entry.content:
1. Introduction  

 

Against the backdrop of accelerated digital transformation and ever-rising demand for agile operations and intelligent decision-making, SAP Analytics Cloud—with its robust, all-in-one capabilities—is rapidly becoming the cornerstone platform for empowering business management and strategic decisions. By seamlessly integrating data visualization, predictive analytics, planning, and collaboration, it not only helps organizations spot trends and optimize processes but also delivers an enterprise-wide, intelligent operating framework.
 
Within SAP Analytics Cloud, the Calendar is heavily used for corporate planning, event scheduling, task tracking, and cross-functional collaboration. Yet its ability to perform bulk edits on event context remains a conspicuous weak spot.
 
For example, once a large-scale process is generated from a standardized template, any subsequent, organization-wide adjustment to a key dimension—such as time or region—can currently be accomplished only by using the "Replace Context" option inside "Edit Event". This approach, however, wipes out all existing context information, forcing teams to reconfigure every dimension manually. The result is significant human effort and a heightened risk of inconsistencies and governance issues.

To address this pain-point, I built a story-based application powered by the SAC Calendar APIs that delivers true "point-to-point" bulk editing of event context. Users simply enter the ID of a process; the app renders the full hierarchy—parent process, sub-processes, and child events—so the exact scope for modification can be pinpointed in seconds. Next, they can flexibly pick the target model, the context dimension that needs adjustment, and the new member(s) to be assigned. The chosen dimension is updated across all selected events in one shot, while every other dimension remains untouched, ensuring no downstream re-work or loss of existing settings.

This capability is especially valuable when:
• A standard-template process has been generated and a single dimension (e.g., time, region) must be aligned rapidly across the entire structure.
• Organizational or strategic shifts require only a targeted context revision—no need to re-initialize the entire configuration.

 

2. How to Use the “Calendar Event Context Batch Modification” Application 

Before using the story app, please read the in-story instructions on the same page.
 
1. Permissions required
• Read access to public files
• Read access to planning models
 
2. Obtain the parent calendar process Event ID as follows:
Select the event → click Details (top-right corner) → in the pop-up menu bar, click More (top-right again) → choose Event Settings.

  • If the "Allow External API Access" checkbox is not selected, please select it now.

  • Then click "Show Details" to view and copy the Event ID.

 

3. Paste the Event ID into the text box and click "Confirm"; the structure of the process and its sub-events will then be displayed in the next panel.

 

4. In the next panel, select the scope you want to modify and click "Confirm".
Please note that not every selected event will necessarily be updated; actual modification depends on whether the event (1) uses the model you subsequently choose and (2) contains the dimension you subsequently specify.

 

5. In the next panel, select the model that the context you want to modify references, then click "Confirm".

 

6. In the next panel, choose the dimension you want to modify, then click "Confirm".

 

7. In the next panel, update the dimension members as follows:

  • Click one dimension. 

  • Proceed as shown in the example below.

 

8. Click "Confirm" if every dimension is ready. 

 

9.  Once the changes are applied, the right-hand panel will display the execution log.

 

10. To modify additional sub-events, simply return to Step 4 and repeat the process.

 

3. Important Notes

The following task types cannot be replaced:
• Data Locking tasks
• Data Action tasks
• Multi-Action tasks
• Input tasks

 

4. Codes 

Before diving in, let’s clarify three core concepts:
• Dimension – a specific aspect or categorical axis within a model.
• Member – an individual instance or category item under a given dimension.
• Filter – a combination of one dimension plus one or more of its members, used to narrow the data to a desired analytical scope.
The following outlines the main implementation logic, broken into steps:
 
1. Variables & Page Initialization
Before the feature can run, enable “Calendar Integration” in the story app and initialize the required variables. Key variables are listed below:
// Reference to the DataSource object of the chosen model
datasource              

// Array of IDs for the parent process and all its descendants
eventsIds               

// Boolean flag indicating whether every event in the hierarchy is selected (used by the “Select All” toggle)
isEventsAllSelected     

// ID of the model whose context is being edited
modelId                 

// Array holding every filter that involves the currently selected dimension across all chosen events
// Example: if dimension A is selected, all filters containing A are pushed here
selectedFilters         

// Array of event objects that will actually be modified after all filtering rules are applied
toBeModifiedEvents      

// ----------------------------------------------------------
// The next two arrays act together like a 2-D map:
//   index i links modelId → dimensionId
// ----------------------------------------------------------
uniqueModelDimensionId_1  // Stores model IDs
uniqueModelDimensionId_2  // Stores the corresponding dimension IDs for each model

 

During page initialization, the system-message notification types are configured (e.g., success, warning, error).

2. Validate and retrieve the process with all its children 

 

//获取event ID。Get the event ID. 
var userInput_processID = InputField_1.getValue(); 
var processEvent = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(userInput_processID); 
//如果获取不到对象，则报错。 If the object cannot be obtained, an error will be reported. 
if (processEvent === undefined) { 
    Application.showMessage(ApplicationMessageType.Warning, "Please enter a correct ID."); 
    Application.hideBusyIndicator(); 
    return; 
}

 

Use a breadth-first search (BFS) with two synchronized queues:
• idQueue – stores the event IDs
• spaceQueue – stores the depth level so the hierarchy can be rendered clearly
For each event:
  1. Fetch its full object.
  2. Bind its properties to the corresponding checkbox.
  3. If the event is itself a process, enqueue all of its children (child IDs → idQueue, depth+1 → spaceQueue).

 

//BFS  
var idQueue = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
var spaceQueue = ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); 
idQueue.push(processEvent.getId()); 
//spaceQueue以字符的形式标明了目前遍历到第几层。 spaceQueue indicates the current level of traversal in the form of characters. 
spaceQueue.push(""); 
while (idQueue.length > 0) { 
    var currentId = idQueue.shift(); 
    var currentSpace = spaceQueue.shift(); 
    var currentEvent = CalendarIntegration_1.getCalendarEventById(currentId); 
    if (currentEvent !== undefined) { 
        CheckboxGroup_1.addItem(currentId, currentSpace + currentEvent.getName()); 
        eventsIds.push(currentId); 
        if (currentEvent.getType() === CalendarTaskType.Process) { 
            var currentProcess = cast(Type.CalendarProcess, currentEvent);
